title: Self-Directed GCSE Chemistry Experiment-Based Social Problem-Solving Project

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic chemistry theories (acid-base reactions, concentration calculations) and laboratory safety protocols
context.additional_context: Program for cultivating scientific application skills to solve social issues, designed for working professionals.

learning_goals: Students can apply chemical concentration calculation methods with 90% accuracy through acid-base titration experiments
Learners can plan and execute experimental designs using a guided inquiry approach with an 80% completion rate
Participants can analyze experimental results to propose solutions for real-world environmental issues (e.g., water quality management)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
